revision.text:
{{Infobox XC3 Status |title = Fast Recharge |image = XC3 Fast Recharge.png |caption = Improves rate of recharge. |type = Buff |base-duration = 20.0s |max-duration = 40.0s |rng-applicable = Yes |effect-title-1 = Base Recharge Boost |effect-value-1 = 20% }} '''Fast Recharge''' is a [[Status Effect]] in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}. As its name implies, it grants improved recharge to the affected character; Keves cooldown timers will tick faster, Agnus arts will gain more charge per auto-attack or Art cancel, and Talent Arts will gain more charge upon a Role Action.
==Notes== *Fast Recharge's effect is additive with all other effects that improve recharge, such as [[Guardian Commander]]'s Protector's Pride skill or the [[Awakening (XC3)|Awakening]] buff. *The buff also applies to Arts and skills that recharges Arts upon activation, such as [[Martial Artist]]'s Frenzied Combo skill. [[Soulhacker]] skills that activate with cooldowns, such as Reserve Life, do not benefit. <ref>[https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jk31xdLvfPrOjoQtGr-6PRH_4Cd2B_k_dFGSS6vSJ1g XC3 Postgame Combat Guide including Art and Skill mechanics]</ref>
==Distribution==
===Arts=== *[[Desperate Charge]] (Soulhacker; requires Soul Hacking [[King Krawkin]]) *[[Golden Heart]] ([[Lapidarist]]) *[[Ring o' Roses (XC3)|Ring o' Roses]] ([[Troubadour]]; field effect) *[[Empty Shell]] ([[Miyabi]]; field effect) *[[Searing Fury]] ([[Cammuravi]])
===Skills=== *[[Soulhacker#Enemy Skills|Dodge Acceleration]] (Soulhacker; chance-based trigger on evasion, requires Soul Hacking [[Gushing Masquin]])
==References== <references></references>

[[File:Green Feris.jpeg|thumb|Feris model in {{XC|-}}]] '''Feris''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|フェリス}}, ''Ferisu'', lit. ''Felis'', Felid) are large cat-like enemies in the {{XC|serieslink}}. These creatures are most likely to be based on lions and leopards, hence the name derived from ''feline''.
Feris undergo a massive appearance change between games; in {{XC}} and {{XCFC|sublink}}, they resemble spotted lions with large, spiked manes. In {{XC2}}, {{TTGC}}, and {{XC3}} they retain the mane but otherwise are completely different - they are brown with red hair and dog-like, with long muzzles and bushy tails. In {{TTGC|-}} they are paler with orange hair.
== {{XC|-}} == They are found on the [[Bionis]], in [[Satorl Marsh]], [[Makna Forest]], and on [[Valak Mountain]]. Veteran Yozel and the Green Feris are the most powerful Feris, at level 83.
=== Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Green Feris]] * [[Lupus Feris]] * [[Makna Feris]] * [[Noto Feris]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Veteran Yozel]]

== {{XC3|-}} == Feris appear in the world of [[Aionios]]. === Normal Minor Enemies === * [[Caelum Feris]] * [[Curran Feris]] * [[Land Feris]] * [[Robnos Feris]] * [[Soldato Feris]]
=== Quest Exclusive Enemies === * [[Enkrees Feris]] (During ''[[Prison Spring Clean]]'') * [[Medolya Feris]] (During ''[[Fear of the Unknown]]'') * [[Yunnae Feris]] (During ''[[Alexandria's Birthday]]'')
=== Quest Exclusive Bosses === * [[Basreek Feris]] (During ''[[Second Day of Prison]]'')
=== Unique Monster === * [[Doomfang Caum]]
== {{XC3FR|sub}} == In {{XC3FR|sublink}}, only [[Fogbeast]] Feris appear.
=== Normal Minor Enemy === * [[Dark Feris]]
=== Unique Monster === * [[Fogstalker Naiara]]
=== Boss === * [[Diastone Feris]]

{{Infobox quest |name = Ferron x Ferron |image = XC3 Challenge Battle Mode.png |description = "This sparring match with Segiri and No. 13. One hinder movement, and one bring damage. So fearsome!" |giver = [[Nopon Archsage]] |location = [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]] |prereqs = Chapter 7 started
[[Machine Assassin]] ascended |difficultyCB3 = 3 |rewards = }} '''Ferron x Ferron''' is a Time Attack [[Challenge Battle Mode|Challenge Battle]] in {{XC3}}. It can be received from [[Nopon Archsage]] in the [[Land of Challenge (XC3)|Land of Challenge]], available as downloadable content from the second part of the Expansion Pass. Clearing this challenge with at least an A rank for the first time will unlock the Swimwear B outfit for [[Taion]]. == Challenge Rules == {| class="xc1" | Waves || 1 |- | Level Restriction || Lv 60 |} == Enemies == {| class="xc1" ! Wave ! Enemy ! Level |- | rowspan="2" | 1 || [[Segiri#Challenge Battle Mode|No. 7 Segiri]] || 65 |- | [[No. 13#Challenge Battle Mode|No. 13]] || 63 |} [[Category:XC3 Challenge Battles]]

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox Character |name = Ferronis |image = XC3 Noah and Mio facing Large Machine Enemy.jpeg |description = Noah and Mio fighting [[Colony Lambda]]'s Ferronis |gender = |age = |species = |haircolor = |eyecolor = |voiceactorjp = |voiceactoreng = |appearances = {{XC3}}
{{XC3FR|sublink}} }} '''Ferronis''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|鉄巨神}}, ''Tetsu Kyoshin'', lit. ''Iron Giant God'') are huge mobile military bases in {{XC3}} and {{XC3FR|sublink}}.https://www.nintendo.com/store/products/xenoblade-chronicles-3-switch/ == Overview == These mobile bases, which are independent army and living place for soldiers, rest at the heart of each [[Colony]] (Japanese: {{lang|ja|コロニー}}, ''koronī''). If the need arises, they are also capable of becoming devastating weapons of war. There are numerous colonies and some of them have various roles, such as producing weapons instead of battling.https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1494209326768336901?cxt=HHwWisDR4endv7wpAAAA Other Ferronis are small enough to be piloted by a single individual and are used as mobile assault weapons. The armies of [[Keves]] and [[Agnus]] utilize dozens of these giants. While the Ferronis of Keves must be boarded and operated by individual soldiers, those of Agnus are capable of autonomous movement.https://twitter.com/xenobladejp/status/1491546292673146890?s=21 If a Ferronis' [[Flame Clock]] runs empty, the people who belong to that Ferronis are doomed to die.https://twitter.com/XenobladeJP/status/1539776568465076226 However, destroying the Flame Clock will free them from this limitation. The only known weapons capable of destroying Flame Clocks are [[Lucky Seven]], the [[Monado]], the [[Monado Replica EX+|Monado REX+]], and the [[Blade (XC3)|Firelight Swords]]. == List of Ferronis Enemies == === {{XC3|-}} === * [[Lambda Ferronis]] * [[Cammuravi's Ferronis]] * [[Ethel's Ferronis]] * [[Queen of Agnus (boss)|Queen of Agnus]] * [[Crys|Consul Crys]] (second phase) === {{XC3FR|sub}} === * [[Colony Eta Ferronis]] * [[Agnian Ferronis]] * [[Kevesi Ferronis]] == Ferronis Hulks == {{main|Ferronis Hulk}} [[File:Ferronis Hulk Icon.png|thumb|180px|Ferronis Hulk]] Throughout the world, the party may come across [[Ferronis Hulk]]s that are decrepit Ferronis and can be rebooted and used as [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spots]]. As the party approaches the Ferronis Hulk, a [[Quest (XC3)|quest]] will activate. These quests involve defeating several enemies that are around the Hulk. After the enemies are defeated, the party must then reboot the Ferronis using a certain amount of [[Ether Cylinder (XC3)|Ether Cylinders]]. After rebooting a Ferronis Hulk, its [[Fabricator]] becomes usable and the [[Container]]s next to the Ferronis Hulk will unlock. The Ferronis Hulk will also be able to be used as a Rest Spot, and [[Nopon Merchant]]s will appear at the Hulk, along with a new [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] [[Shop (XC3)|Shop]]. == Trivia == * Their Japanese name is similar to that of [[Bionis]] (Japanese: {{lang|ja|巨神}}, ''Kyoshin'', lit. ''Giant God'') and that of the [[Titan]]s (Japanese: {{lang|ja|巨神獣}}, ''Kyoshin-jū'', lit. ''Giant Divine Beasts''). * The designs of the Kevesi and Agnian Ferronis are based on [[Mechon|Faced Mechon]] and [[Artifice]]s, respectively. == Gallery == XC3 Colony 9 Ferronis Screenshot.jpg|The Ferronis of Colony 9 XC3 Colony 9 Overlook.png|View of Colony 9's Ferronis from Yzana Plains XC3 Colony Gamma Ferronis Screenshot.jpg|The Ferronis of Colony Gamma XC3 Colony 4.jpg|The Ferronis of Colony 4 XC3 Great Cotte Falls 01.jpg|The Ferronis of Colony Lambda seen from Great Cotte Falls XC3 Aionios Screenshot 5.jpeg|Eunie near the Colony Lambda Ferronis XC3 Aionios Screenshot 6.jpeg|Colony Gamma's Ferronis overlooking its encampment XC3 Eagus Wilderness Colony Screenshot.jpg|Colony Iota's Ferronis XC3 Iron Giant Flame Clock.jpg|The flame clock of a Ferronis Colony 5 Wreckage.jpg|The wreckage of Colony 5's Ferronis in {{XC3FR|sub}} Colony Gamma Wreckage.jpg|The wreckage of Colony Gamma's Ferronis in {{XC3FR|sub}} Double Ferronis.jpg|A combination of two Ferronis by a Moebius == References == {{xc3 stub}} {{Fr stub}} [[Category:XC3 Ferronis]] [[Category:XC3 Species]] [[Category:XC3 Vehicles]] [[Category:XC3 Machines]] [[Category:XC3FR Ferronis]] [[Category:XC3FR Species]] [[Category:XC3FR Machines]] [[Category:Pages needing plot info]] [[Category:Ferronis]] [[Category:Species by Type]]

{{spoiler}} {{Infobox location |name = Ferronis Hulk |image = Ferronis Hulk Icon.png |caption = Ferronis Hulk Icon |type = Point of interest |located = [[Aetia Region|Aetia]], [[Fornis Region|Fornis]], [[Pentelas Region|Pentelas]] and [[Cadensia Region]]s |function = Rest Spots with Shops after rebooting }} '''Ferronis Hulks''' (Japanese: {{lang|ja|朽ちた鉄巨神}}, ''Kuchita Tetsukyoshin'', Fallen Iron Titan) are points of interest in {{XC3}}.
== Overview == Throughout the world, the party may come across one of the eight Ferronis Hulks that are decrepit [[Ferronis]] and can be rebooted and used as [[Rest Spot (XC3)|Rest Spots]]. As the party approaches the Ferronis Hulk, a [[Quest (XC3)|quest]] will activate. These quests involve defeating several enemies that are around the Hulk. After the enemies are defeated, the party must then reboot the Ferronis using a certain amount of [[Ether Cylinder (XC3)|Ether Cylinders]].
After rebooting a Ferronis Hulk, its [[Fabricator]] becomes usable and the [[Container]]s next to the Ferronis Hulk will unlock. The Ferronis Hulk will also be able to be used as a Rest Spot, and [[Nopon Merchant]]s will appear at the Hulk, along with a new [[Accessory (XC3)|Accessory]] [[Shop (XC3)|Shop]].
== List of Ferronis Hulks == There are eight Ferronis Hulks throughout Aionios.
* [[Battlescar Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Everblight Plain]]) * [[Hillside Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Millick Meadows]]) * [[Desert Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Dannagh Desert (XC3)|Dannagh Desert]]) * [[Tableland Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Rae-Bel Tableland]]) * [[Cascade Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Great Cotte Falls]]) * [[Clifftop Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Urayan Trail]]) * [[Atoll Ferronis Hulk]] ([[Erythia Sea]]) * [[Sandbar Ferronis Hulk]] (Erythia Sea)
[[Category:XC3 Points of Interest]] [[Category:Aetia Region]] [[Category:Fornis Region]] [[Category:Pentelas Region]] [[Category:Cadensia Region]] [[Category:XC3 Ferronis]]

{{Infobox XC3 Enemy |category = Unique Monster |name = Fineblade Faltaar |image = XC3 Fineblade Faltaar.png |caption = Fineblade Faltaar |type = [[Taos]] |level = 47 |area = [[Great Sword's Hilt]] |spawntime = Anytime |respawn = Yes |movement = Air |detection = |exp = 1,434 |cp = 403 |sp = 5 |gold = 852 |hp = 1,160,000 |strength = 687 |healing = 415 |dexterity = 209 |agility = 200 |physdef = -10% |ethdef = 25% |critrate = 23% |guardrate = 0% }} '''Fineblade Faltaar''' is a [[Unique Monster (XC3)|Unique Monster]] in {{XC3}}. It is a member of the [[Taos]] family, and can be found at level 47 north of the [[Material Storage Warehouse]] on the [[Great Sword's Hilt]]. The [[Dino Flash]] [[Battle Arts (XC3)|Art]] can be earned by the [[Soulhacker]] [[Class (XC3)|class]] by defeating it.
== Resistances == {{XC3 Resistances |break = 40% |physdebuff = 25% |etherdebuff = 60% |knockback = 100% |blowdown = 100% }} {{clr}}
